text: Yukhym Konoplya (; born 26 August 1999) is a professional Ukrainian football defender who plays on loan for FC Desna Chernihiv in the Ukrainian Premier League. ==Career== Born in the Donetsk Oblast, Konoplya is a product of the Shakhtar Donetsk youth sportive school system in his native city. === Shakhtar Donetsk === Konoplya played with Shakhtar Donetsk U19 in UEFA Youth League for the season 2017-18 and 2018-19. === FC Desna Chernihiv === In summer 2019 he moved on loan to Desna Chernihiv the main club in Chernihiv and he made his début for FC Desna Chernihiv in the Ukrainian Premier League as a second-half substituted player in a winning home match against FC Vorskla Poltava on 3 August 2019.Yukhym Konoplya with the club of Chernihiv qualified for the Europa League third qualifying round, for the first time in the history of the Club.In summer 2020 the club FC Desna Chernihiv agreed to extend his contract for 1 year more Konoplya was also included in the team of Desna Chernihiv against VfL Wolfsburg for the Europa League third qualifying round at the AOK Stadion. ==International career== Konoplya was a part of the Ukraine national under-20 football team that won the 2019 FIFA U-20 World Cup. He played one of the key roles in Ukraine's success, appearing in 6 from all 7 of his team's matches and made a four-goal assists. He was included in the team of Ukraine U21 where he played 5 games and he won the Valeriy Lobanovskyi Memorial Tournament in 2019 On 8 of September 2020 he scored a goal for the winning victory away against Finland U21 for the 2021 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification Group 8.He has been called for the Ukraine national football team, for friendly match against France and UEFA Nations League matches against Germany and Spain on 7, 10 and 13 October 2020 respectively, becoming the first player of Desna Chernihiv called in the main team.
